results.title: Growth of intelligence in the pre-school years
results.brief_description: Documents the growth of the thinking processes in the preschool years. Illustrates developmental changes and clarifies certain Piagetian terms often mystifying the student of Piaget.

results.title: Growth of infant behaviour: Later stages
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Arnold Gesell
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the increasing ability of the growing infant to use his hands in manipulating objects. Shows the definite and predictable stages by which the hand grows from an almost useless organ to the dextrous and sensitive instrument of the human will.

results.title: Growth of Cities
results.brief_description: A study of some of the factors, which determine the location and rate of expansion of cities, showing the general trend towards a centralization in USA. The factors involved in decentralization of cities, into metropolitan areas as applied to various types of cities, and various theories of city and town planning are presented.
results.description: A study of some of the factors, which determine the location and rate of expansion of cities, showing the general trend towards a centralization in USA. The factors involved in decentralization of cities, into metropolitan areas as applied to various types of cities, and various theories of city and town planning are presented.

results.title: Growth of adaptive behaviour
results.brief_description: This short film shows the development of adaptive behaviour in a child staring at 15 weeks and going through to 4 years; mainly with crayons. Shows the child’s 4 year old drawing revealing the pattern of adaptive behaviour.

results.title: Growth model
results.brief_description: Presents views on limits to growth, including the availability of space, decreasing stores of natural resources and reduced effectiveness of social institutions. Also offers a scenario of the life of a young couple living in a growing society which lacks stabilising mechanisms.

results.title: Growth and propagation
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
The concept of vegetative propagation is explained and how new plant cells are created in the growing points or meristems of plants. Discusses the importing of flower cuttings into Australia and the growing of potatoes. Using two case studies, the viewer is shown tissue culture techniques used to combat the plant disease Phytophthora, or “Jarrah dieback” and how genetic engineering is used to create a Blue Rose.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivo Burum, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Growth
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
A hand-cart and bicycle, then a delivery wagon and a horse - Sam Steinberg reminisces over the fifty years of his company’s growth into a large, diversified corporation. A company cannot stand still, it must go forward he claims. In this film you see the process continuing as corporation executives meet to consider interrelated operations, projects and priorities. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
